summary: The FinCEN Oversight and Accountability Act of 2025 seeks to increase congressional oversight and public transparency of the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN). The bill requires the Treasury Secretary to keep congressional committees informed of FinCEN's activities and report any unlawful conduct. It mandates the public and congressional disclosure of documents delegating authority to FinCEN. The act also establishes an annual working group to improve coordination and provide guidance to the small business community regarding beneficial ownership reporting obligations, and it extends the retention period for beneficial ownership data from 5 to 10 years.
